hypothesis_content.title: Post-CPI Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a major macro catalyst (US CPI print) that results in a sharp intraday move (>3%) but closes within ±1% of the pre-announcement price, a period of 6-12 hours of compressed volatility (ATR(1h) < 0.5% of price) will resolve with a directional move that continues the initial intraday spike direction, amplified by trapped liquidity and stop-loss cascades.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major catalysts create violent but often non-directional 'whipsaws' that trap both sides. The subsequent compression represents a coiled spring as liquidity providers reposition and stop orders accumulate at range edges. The break tends to be explosive as one side's stops trigger a cascade.
entry_conditions: BTC experiences >3% absolute move within 1 hour of CPI release (8:30 AM ET)
BTC 4-hour closing candle returns to within ±1% of price at 8:25 AM ET
Subsequent 6-hour period shows ATR(1h) < 0.5% of price (volatility compression)
Enter on break of 6-hour high (if initial spike was up) or low (if initial spike was down) with >0.8% move from compression range midpoint

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Other side of compression range (e.g., if long, stop below range low)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 24 hours after entry if TP/SL not hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such setups result in a 'false break' that immediately reverses back into the compression range within 2 hours, or volatility remains elevated without a clear compression phase.
